column4: so I could do apt-build with ubuntu...can I set some compiler flags somewhere ?
yes
but why do you want to?
is ubuntu compiled for i386 arch ?
yes...
well I'd like to have it optimized for my machine (ie: not i386)
uhm, i386 refers to the 386 memory system - aka IA32.
then is ubuntu optimized for what processor ?
Processor-dependant optimizations are a *myth*
The exception being floating-point-heavy stuff.
ok, but is ubuntu compiled for i386 like redhat ?
but some of these feature runtime detection.
it is compiled for the intel 386-and-up processors, yes
i386 just refers to the 32-bit processor architechture Intel introduced together with the 386
yea, but would rather have stuff compiled for i686...where would I set compiler flags in ubuntu ?
*sigh*
i686 *is* an i386 processor
there are *very few* added instructions that differentiate it from the 386
those that are (the MMX, MMX2, SSE, SSE2, 3DNow!, 3DNow! 2 instruction sets) are usually explicitly tested for by most applications
ok
The performance gained by explicitly telling GCC to compile for 686 are truly trivial
